message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.CL

The paper proposes a method for sequential recommendation using a memory augmented graph neural network. This involves modeling short-term and long-term user interests, as well as item co-occurrence patterns. The paper also evaluates the proposed method on real-world datasets. Based on these characteristics, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves graph modeling, which suggests cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves natural language processing, which suggests cs.CL (Computation and Language) as another possible sub-category.
